question: Which of the following is a semantic error?

answers.feedback: A semantic error is an error in logic. In this case the program does not produce the correct output because the problem is not solved correctly. This would be considered a run-time error.

answers.answer: Forgetting the closing parenthesis ) on a print statement.
answers.feedback: In this case the program does not produce the correct output because the code can not be processed by the compiler or interpreter. This would be considered a syntax error.

answers.answer: Forgetting to divide by 100 when printing a percentage amount.
answers.feedback: This will produce the wrong answer because the programmer implemented the solution incorrectly. This is a semantic error.
